definition: state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

sentences.english: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.
sentences.chinese: 机会经常隐臧在不幸煳暂时的失败中。

sentences.english: Personally I am in favor of the former point of view.
sentences.chinese: 就我团体而言，我较同也臧一种看法。

sentences.english: As sheepherders, Zang and Gu lost some sheep due to their neglect.
sentences.chinese: 臧与谷两个牧羊人，他们都因疏忽而丢失了一些羊。

sentences.english: King Wen had stayed at his summer resort in Zang for some days.
sentences.chinese: 文王到臧避暑已经有一段日子了。

definition: barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]
surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers

surname Wei/name of vassal state of Zhou dynasty from 661 BC in Shanxi, one of the Seven Hero Warring States/Wei state, founded by Cao Cao 曹操[Cao2 Cao1], one of the Three Kingdoms after the Han dynasty/the Wei dynasty 221-265/Wei prefecture and Wei county at different historical periods
class or grade/generation/plaintiff and defendant (old)/government department (old)
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
